page.title: 04BRACEBRIDGE HEATH
page.content: {LIFE ON A NEW ESTATE When we went to Bracebridge Heath we went around the close off Main Avenue. We met an old lady who has been living at her house on the new estate for nine weeks.She has arthritis so she cannot walk very far.Her husband was a pilot in the RAF.She said she was used to the aeroplane noises from nearby RAF Waddington because she had always lived at or near an RAF camp. { She spent most of her time}looking after her garden which was very pretty with lots of flowers in it. There are no shops here so tradsesmen come round in vans selling potatoes,ice cream and vegetables .These goods are more expensive than in the shops because they have to pay for the petrol.
